intro: Cirsium molle, commonly known as soft thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant features spiny, lobed leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. Its flowers are typically purple or pink, arranged in a dense, spherical shape. Cirsium molle is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
